alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 12:35PM EDT until July 11 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Contoocook River At Henniker affecting Hillsborough and Merrimack Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Oxford and Cumberland Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Contoocook River at Henniker. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, In the town of Hillsborough, Hennicker Street and Bear Hill Road flood. In Henniker, flood waters encroach on parts of Western Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:17 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:17 PM EDT Tuesday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 9.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
